{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3172874,"name":"David Lame","username":"David_Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-25T20:26:09.170Z","cooked":"

There is a problem with our spark maxes. The symptoms; at the end of a match, we observed no light. We tried recovery mode. It didn’t work. Replace spark max. Nes spark max fails a few minutesater. No light. Emergency recovery mode fails. Get another. Configure via USB, update software. Put on robot. Does. No recovery.

At this point, we are pretty sure that the problem isn’t the spark max. But what is it? We’re down to our last spare. Our thought is that the motor is the most like failure that might cause the spark maxes to die, so we will replace that before the we replace the most recent dead spark max, but we thought we might ask the chief Delphi community for alternative suggestions.

Motors Permanently Destroy Spark MAX — Symptoms to Watch (easiest) way to connect (wire and program) Thrifty Absolute Magnetic Encoder to REV SPARK MAX Motor There is an issue with a few Neo’s (that has been fixed now) where the Neo could kill the motor controller through the encoder port bc the cable is shorted. If you replace the Neo it should be fine

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-25T20:27:48.507Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":455,"readers_count":454,"score":196.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/2","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3172902,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-25T21:35:45.909Z","cooked":"

Yeah, we lost three SparkMaxes that way from a shorted Neo550. Then the new SparkMaxes stopped working even though we’d replaced the motor. In the end, we just redesigned the mechanism and used one Falcon where we’d had two Neo550s. It works perfectly now.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-25T21:35:45.909Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":428,"readers_count":427,"score":130.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"Stewart Riley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32783,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I plan, therefore I am"},"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/3","custom_user_title":"I plan, therefore I am","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3172905,"name":"NathanNFM","username":"NathanNFM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathannfm/{size}/181060_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-25T21:41:35.223Z","cooked":"

The motor is likely burnt up and internally shorted, we just killed 3 Spark Maxes this way today

You can check the motor by spinning it by hand. If there’s more resistance to spinning compared to a new motor its probably bad.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-25T21:41:35.223Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":416,"readers_count":415,"score":188.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"NathanNFM","primary_group_name":"AndyMark","flair_name":"AndyMark","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/7/2/72db24f824a25ae17c6413b3d02a345e47f060a9.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":59,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/avoidable-common-failures-add-yours/433583/44","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Avoidable common failures (add yours!)","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14566,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"AndyMark Senior Mechanical Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/4","custom_user_title":"AndyMark Senior Mechanical Engineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3172974,"name":"David Lame","username":"David_Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-26T01:41:21.564Z","cooked":"

We opened up the Neo, and sure enough it was bad, and we saw how the burnout would short the other wires.

It was a fairly expensive competition for us. We burned several Neos before the day was over.

We really aren’t sure why they are blowing. We’ve had the robot finished for six week, and this is our second competition. To be faire we did burn one at the last competition. For this competition, we can’t keep them alive.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-26T01:43:46.344Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":316,"readers_count":315,"score":98.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"David Lame","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14566,"username":"NathanNFM","name":"NathanNFM","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathannfm/{size}/181060_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24723,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3172975,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-26T01:43:11.104Z","cooked":"

It happens, you can ask REV from replacements but idk if they do that for this issue?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-26T01:43:11.104Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":290,"readers_count":289,"score":58.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24723,"username":"David_Lame","name":"David Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/6","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3172988,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-26T02:11:43.681Z","cooked":"

Were they NEOs or NEO550s? If 550’s, did you have a current limit set for them? What breaker were they on?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-26T02:11:43.681Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":266,"readers_count":265,"score":53.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24723,"username":"David_Lame","name":"David Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/7","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3173009,"name":"","username":"Sylent","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sylent/{size}/180576_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-26T02:51:55.350Z","cooked":"

We’ve been having the same problem with 1 of our sparks. It could have been connected to one of our NEO 550s that has a broken encoder wire according to the other replies, but I’m not sure.
Is it possible that the NEO 550 with the broken encoder wire can be used without it, ignoring the sensor error that a spark max would give?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-26T02:51:55.350Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":245,"readers_count":244,"score":54.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55795,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3985 - Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/8","custom_user_title":"3985 - Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3173042,"name":"Davo","username":"auscompgeek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/auscompgeek/{size}/9867_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-26T04:20:59.178Z","cooked":"
Sylent:

Is it possible that the NEO 550 with the broken encoder wire can be used without it, ignoring the sensor error that a spark max would give?

No. The Spark Max only supports sensored brushless motors.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-26T04:20:59.178Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":227,"readers_count":226,"score":50.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"Davo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31229,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4774 mentor, RobotPy dev, CSA/RI"},"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/9","custom_user_title":"4774 mentor, RobotPy dev, CSA/RI","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3173050,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-26T04:44:51.087Z","cooked":"

Had asked Greg about best way to go with this - his suggestion was that if you do burn out a sparkmax or a neo, safest route is to replace both until you can confirm which item is unusable.

We are not running sparks but this is good information for any spark max users to have. As Nathan mentioned above, a shorted motor can then damage the spark max, leading to some expensive replacements.

Unsure where this falls in terms of user error/product failure mode, but the best way to ask is to email Rev support.

Were you current limiting your motors? Do you double check your encoder wires aren’t getting pulled? Those seem to be the most common issues I’ve seen and helped teams with at our events. Did you ever figure out the root cause of the issues? Burn out the same mechanism each time?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-26T04:53:08.112Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":56.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24723,"username":"David_Lame","name":"David Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/10","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3173733,"name":"David Lame","username":"David_Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-27T02:59:40.425Z","cooked":"

After the match we ripped apart the suspected Neo (Neo550, indeed). The insulation on the thin white wire, that goes into the sensor cable to the Spark Max, was visibly melted. That wire runs directly adjacent to the motor windings. I’m told that the white wire is the temperature sense wire. Anyway, we confirmed with the multimeter that there was a short circuit between the sensor wire and the motor’s 12 volt power input, so 12 volts went onto a line that was intended for 5 volts, and the Spark Max found this unacceptable, and now refuses to talk to us.

So that’s confirmed. It was a secondary failure following Neo failure.

I’ve read a lot about current limiting in the past two weeks, and even more so in the last 48 hours. We’ll be doing that in the future.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-27T03:00:15.963Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":97.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":431727,"topic_slug":"our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas","display_username":"David Lame","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":8002,"username":"Akash_Rastogi","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24723,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/our-spark-maxes-are-dying-any-ideas/431727/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3343675,"name":"system","username":"system","avatar_template":"/uploads/default/original/4X/9/3/2/93234578e69f55873c63fc00fe2d0d85f23bce55.png","created_at":"2024-03-26T03:00:13.531Z","cooked":"
